org.mundo.rt
Class Session

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Session
All Implemented Interfaces:
IReceiver
public class Session
extends java.lang.Object
implements IReceiver

Sessions manage publishers, subscribers and exported objects. Instances of Session are owned by a Service and have the following responsiblities:

  • They manage advertisements, subscriptions and exported objects.
  • Sessions implement the Active Object Pattern to decouple message reception from message handling. (This behaviour is optional and can be controlled via the dispatch mode.)
  • Sessions control execution. Only one message handler associated with a session is active at any time. The session serializes incoming messages.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler
See Also:
Service

Field Detail

DISPATCH_SYNC

public static final int DISPATCH_SYNC
Use synchronous dispatch. In this mode, on reception of a message, the appropriate message handler is called directly. This has the following consequences:
  • Messages are dispatched with lower latency.
  • A blocking message handler stalls other services.
  • Nested remote method calls are not possible, if the callee calls a method of the caller.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DISPATCH_ASYNC

public static final int DISPATCH_ASYNC
Use decoupled dispatch. In this mode, received messages are queued and dispatched by a separate thread to the appropriate message hander. The disadvantage of this mode is a higher requirement of system resources, since each session creates an additional thread. However, decoupled dispatch will improve performance on multiprocessor machines.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DISPATCH_DISABLED

public static final int DISPATCH_DISABLED
Dispatch is disabled. This mode is used internally to disable dispatch after shutdown.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getChannel

public Channel getChannel(java.lang.String zone,
                          java.lang.String name)
Returns a session-specific Channel object for the specified zone and channel names. The channel object is either retrieved from a hashtable or newly created, if it does not already exist.

Parameters:
zone - the zone name.
name - the channel name.
Returns:
the channel object.

getService

public Service getService()
Returns the Service that owns this Session.

Returns:
the service object.

subscribe

public Subscriber subscribe(java.lang.String zone,
                            java.lang.String channelName,
                            IReceiver rcv)
Subscribes to a channel. This method automically subscribes to the specified channel, sets the receiver callback and enables the subscription. The subscription can be removed by calling Session.unsubscribe. All subscriptions are automatically removed when the associated service terminates. Thus, it is not required to manually unsubscribe everything when a service is shut down.

Parameters:
zone - the zone name.
channelName - the channel name.
rcv - the receiver callback that will receive messages.
Returns:
a subscriber object

subscribe

public Subscriber subscribe(java.lang.String zone,
                            java.lang.String channelName)
Subscribes to a channel. After calling this method, it is necessary to set the receiver callback using Subscriber.setReceiver and to enable the subscription with Subscriber.enable. The subscription can be removed by calling Session.unsubscribe. All subscriptions are automatically removed when the associated service terminates. Thus, it is not required to manually unsubscribe everything when a service is shut down.

Parameters:
zone - the zone name.
channelName - the channel name.
Returns:
a subscriber object.

subscribe

public Subscriber subscribe(Channel ch,
                            IReceiver rcv)
Subscribes to a channel. This method automically subscribes to the specified channel, sets the receiver callback and enables the subscription. The subscription can be removed by calling Session.unsubscribe. All subscriptions are automatically removed when the associated service terminates. Thus, it is not required to manually unsubscribe everything when a service is shut down. If the specified channel object is not owned by this session, then a new channel object within this session is created. The new channel object inherits the protocol stack from this session and not from the channel object specified as parameter.

Parameters:
ch - the channel object.
rcv - the receiver callback that will receive messages.
Returns:
a subscriber object

subscribe

public Subscriber subscribe(Channel ch)
Subscribes to a channel. This method automically subscribes to the specified channel and enables the subscription. The subscription can be removed by calling Session.unsubscribe. All subscriptions are automatically removed when the associated service terminates. Thus, it is not required to manually unsubscribe everything when a service is shut down. If the specified channel object is not owned by this session, then a new channel object within this session is created. The new channel object inherits the protocol stack from this session and not from the channel object specified as parameter.

Parameters:
ch - the channel object.
Returns:
a subscriber object

subscribe

public Subscriber subscribe()
Subscribes to a local anonymous channel. This operation is used to create connections to local message routing services. This subscription is only useful in conjunction with SubscriptionParameters.

unsubscribe

public void unsubscribe(Subscriber s)
Unsubscribes from a channel immediately. By calling this method, the client expresses that it no longer wants to receive messages from the associated channel. This operation takes effect immediately.

Parameters:
s - the subscription to unsubscribe.

unsubscribeDelayed

public void unsubscribeDelayed(Subscriber s)
Unsubscribes from a channel. By calling this method, the client expresses that it no longer wants to receive messages from the associated channel. This operation stops enqueuing messages. The subscription is removed as soon as all asynchronously enqueued messages have been delivered.

Parameters:
s - the subscription to unsubscribe.

unsubscribeAll

public void unsubscribeAll()
Unsubscribes all subscriptions of this session.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shuts down the session. Unsubscribes all subscriptions of this session and shuts down the message dispatch thread, if one is running.

publish

public Publisher publish(java.lang.String zone,
                         java.lang.String channelName)
Registers to publish to a channel. This operation is also often called "advertise". By calling this method, the client expresses that it has interest in publishing to the specified channel. publish creates a Publisher object that permits to send messages to the specified channel. The registration can be removed by calling Session.unpublish. All publishers are automatically released when the associated service terminates. Thus, it is not required to manually unpublish everything when a service is shut down.

Parameters:
zone - the zone name.
channelName - the channel name.
Returns:
a publisher object.

publish

public Publisher publish(Channel ch)
Registers to publish to a channel. This operation is also often called "advertise". By calling this method, the client expresses that it has interest in publishing to the specified channel. publish creates a Publisher object that permits to send messages to the specified channel. The registration can be removed by calling Session.unpublish. All publishers are automatically released when the associated service terminates. Thus, it is not required to manually unpublish everything when a service is shut down. If the specified channel object is not owned by this session, then a new channel object within this session is created. The new channel object inherits the protocol stack from this session and not from the channel object specified as parameter.

Parameters:
ch - the channel object.
Returns:
a publisher object.

unpublish

public void unpublish(Publisher p)
Unregisters a publisher. By calling this method, the client expresses that it has no longer interest in publishing to the associated channel.

Parameters:
p - the Publisher object to unregister.

Returns:
the GUID of this session.

send

public void send(GUID targetId,
                 Message msg)
Sends the specified message to the specified target. This method should not be used directly. It is typically used by server stubs to send reply messages to sessions. targetId the GUID of the target channel. msg the message to send.

received

                     MessageContext ctx)
This callback is called when a RMC originated from this session returns a result.

setDispatchMode

public void setDispatchMode(int m)
Sets the message dispatch mode. The default is DISPATCH_ASYNC. On CLDC, the default is DISPATCH_SYNC.

public int getDispatchMode()
Returns the message dispatch mode.
